div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane}
In the District Court of the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Cheney for the counties of Spokane Lincoln and Douglas -

Wilson D. Coyle being duly sworn says that he is the defendant in the above entitled instance that he is accused in the indictment herein, with having committed the crime of an assault with intent to kill on the 14 day of April 1885 and that said indictment was presented on the 16th day of April 1885- Defendant says that he is not guilty of the offense crime with which he stands charged in said indictment- And defendant says that he has duly and fairly stated the facts in this case to his counsel W.H. Smallwood Exp. an attorney of this court who resides at Sprague in the county of Lincoln- and that he is informed by his counsel after such statement made as aforesaid that he has a good valid and complete defense upon the merit to the above

indictment and he hereby swears same to be true. That William Singleton George M Mailer James M Edward Gilson William Kidd are each material witnesses for the defendant. Without the benefit of whose testimony he cannot safely proceed to the trial of this above That he has fully and fairly stated to his counsel aforesaid the facts which he depicts to be after 5 prove by each of said persons named and that he is informed by his said counsel after such statement that they are each necessary and material witnesses and that he cannot safely proceed to the trial of this action with out the testiony of each of said persons - That he expects to be able to prove and believes he will be able to prove by the testimony of William Singleton that some time in the latter part of March or first-part of April 1885. Charles Seaman the person upon whom the crime alleged in said indictment is therin alleged to have been committed. Threatened to do great bodily harm to this defendant and that then and there stated to said William Singleton that he woulf "fix" this defense at the first chance that offend and that he had the tools to do it with

and that he further prove by said William Singleton that information of said trials by said Seaman against this defendant was given to defendant by said Singleton about the first of April 1885, and that said Singleton then warned the defendant and commanded him to be upon guard against attacks of personal violence from said Seaman.

That he expects to be able to prove by and believe he will be to prove by - the said George McMiller that the said Charles Seaman threatended in his presence and hearing that he would do great bodily injury to the defendant when he should find opportunity and that said George McMiller informed this defendant of said threat about three weeks since and warns him beware of said Seaman upon account of said threats

That he expects to be able to provely and believe he will be able to provely by the testimony of James H. McBee - That the said Charles Seaman in the presence and hearing of said James H. McBee threatened that he would shoot this defendant and that knowledge of that said Seaman had made such threat was connected to the defendant by said McBee on or about

That he expects to be abe to prove and believe he will prove by the testimony of Edward Gilson - That the said Charles Seaman threatened that he would do great bodily harm to this defendant and that he stated to said Edward Gilson at the time of making threats that he said Seaman was first to do it and at the same time accompanied said statement with the exhibition of Iron Knuckles and a revoler or pistol and that said Edward Gilson communicated the facts of said trials and statements of said Charles Seaman to this defendant in the month of February Febry 1885.

That he expects to be able to prove by and believe he will prove by the testimony of William Kidd that the said Charles Seaman in the presence and hearing of said Kidd threatened to do great bodily harm to this defendant and said William Kidd committed the fact of such threats being made by said Seaman to this defendant in the month of March 1885 and warned this defendant that he was in danger of his life ot great personal injury at the hands of said Seaman
And defendant further says that none of the persons above named are
now within the jurisdiction of the court as defendant is informed and verily believes -

That said William Singleton is a resident of Sprague in Lincoln County in the Territory and is not absent in the city of Chicago in the said of Illinois - Where he went with person to the in the market and defendant cannot when he will return - that he left this Territory about two weeks since upon said business -

That said George McMiller has resided for some months in Fairview in said county of Lincoln until about three weeks ago at which time he left said town and defendant has been unable to ascertain his present whereabouts although he has made dilligent attempts to ascertain the same.

That the said James H. McBee was a resident of Sprague in said county and left said city on or about the 6th day of April 1885, and at the time of his so leaving he informed this defendant that he was going Flat Head Lake in Montana Territory at which place defendant believes him now to be -
That said Edward Gilson was and defendant verily believes now is a resident

of Lebanon, Linn County Oregon That he was at the residence of defendant in the month of March February 1885, and defendant aforesaid saw him in Sprague in Lincoln County, upon at which time was preparing to leave and he then informed defendant that he was going to his home in said Lebanon -

That said William Kidd was but a casual acquaintance of defendant that said acquaintance was found at Sprague and said Kidd informed defendant that he resided at Helena in Montana Territory and informed defendant at the time he left Sprague that he was going to head home. Said so defendant sayd upon such information & verily believes that said William Kidd is now at Helena Montana Territory and defendant further says that he is unable to prove the same facts which he upheld to prove by the said persons above named as herein
Said defendant further says that the acts octs consisting the alleged crime with which he stands charged having been accused since the summoning og this court. at the present times sufficient time has not eloped an will not elope before the not of this time of said court. Within which it woulf be possible for this defendant to procure the attendance of test- imony of any of said persons to be said upon a trial of this action and this term of this court. But defendant believes that if a con- tinuance of said action be granted he will be able to procure the persons ot testimony of each of said per- sons in time to be used upon the trial thereof at the next term of this court. Defendant further says that this affidavit and applicaton is made in good faith and not for the purpose o delay. Subscribed & sworn to before me this 20th day of April 1885.} W.D. Coyle W.H. Smallwood Notary Public
